p: Another series of chalcones ( Figs. 19, 83–85) isolated from Angelica keiskei were evaluated in terms of their anti-SARS 3CL pro activity. Chalcone 84, which contains perhydroxyl groups, exhibited the most potent inhibitory activity against 3CL pro, with an IC 50 value of 11.4 μM. A detailed ligand-protein mechanistic analysis indicated that the chalcones exhibited competitive inhibition with SARS-CoV 3CL pro [ 81].
